Macron makes state visit to UK in attempt to move past Brexit
description: French President Emmanuel Macron is visiting the United Kingdom on Tuesday, where he will meet with the royal family and Prime Minister Keir Starmer. It is the first state visit by the leader of a member of the European Union since the Brexit crisis of 2020.

In southern Gaza, the doctors at Nasser Hospital face a fierce struggle
description: Medical staff at the major hospital, located in an area gripped by chaos, are having to cope with both a shortage of medical supplies and a daily influx of wounded people.

headline: The United States' 250th anniversary in 2026 is an occasion for Trump to celebrate a history stripped of any 'negative' aspects
description: A giant fair in downtown Washington, a mixed martial arts competition at the White House and a monument honoring national heroes: The American president plans to give the celebrations a resolutely patriotic tone, glossing over the darker chapters of the country's history.

headline: High-stakes sprint finishes heighten tension at the 2025 Tour de France
description: Belgian rider Tim Merlier claimed victory in a sprint finish ahead of Jonathan Milan in Dunkirk during the third stage on Monday. The green jersey holder, Jasper Philipsen, was forced to abandon the race after a serious crash.

headline: Tax on ultra-rich: 'France has the opportunity to lead the way,' say Nobel Prize-winning economists
description: As public deficits balloon and extreme wealth explode, creating a minimum tax on the assets of billionaires should be a priority, argue seven Nobel Prize-winning economists in an op-ed for Le Monde.

Musk breaks with Trump and launches America Party, hoping to attract US voters frustrated by polarization
description: The billionaire, who was the main financial backer of the American president's campaign, has entered politics by striking at a sensitive chord: that of voters' expressed fatigue at the division of American political life into two irreconcilable camps.

headline: Putin's choice of a long war in Ukraine
description: The suspension of American aid to Kyiv fits neatly into the Russian leader's military plans: to intensify his offensive in Ukraine this summer, and to sustain an endless conflict, now synonymous with the survival of his regime through a newfound 'stability' built on a war economy.

headline: In Bosnia and Herzegovina, stone treasures, canyons and cypress trees await
description: The Balkan country, with its painful past, is rich in historical sites and mountainous landscapes − from the Kravica Waterfalls to the Olympic sites of Sarajevo, from a medieval fortress to Tito's bunker.
